Interface tripleplay.gesture.Gesture

Changed Methods
void cancel() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Forcibly put this gesture into the UNQUALIFIED state, as a result of another gesture transitioning to GREEDY.
SignalView<Boolean> completed() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Dispatched when this gesture is completed.
void evaluate(GestureNode) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Perform a potential state transition in this Gesture based on the most recent touch information.
void start() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Called at the start of a new user interaction, forcibly puts this gesture into the PASSIVE state.
SignalView<Void> started() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Dispatched if this gesture goes GREEDY.
State state() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Return the current gesture state.
Gesture<T> greedy(boolean) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Sets whether this gesture should be greedy or not.
boolean greedy() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns whether this gesture will be greedy.
